abstract: Despite high office rents, New York City is emerging as the new home of the mega-rich hedge fund trader – stealing a bit of the thunder from Greenwich, Conn., The New York Post reports. Pointing to Trader Monthly’s recent hedge-fund rankings review, the paper says that five of last year’s 11 highest-earning hedge fund traders call the Big Apple home. Among the big names in the list are Cerberus Capital Management, D.E. Shaw and Atticus Capital.
lead_paragraph: Despite high office rents, New York City is emerging as the new home of the mega-rich hedge fund trader – stealing a bit of the thunder from Greenwich, Conn., The New York Post reports. Pointing to Trader Monthly’s recent hedge-fund rankings review, the paper says that five of last year’s 11 highest-earning hedge fund traders call the Big Apple home. Among the big names in the list are Cerberus Capital Management, D.E. Shaw and Atticus Capital.

headline.main: Top Hedge Funds Are Roosting in New York
